verses.text: A false balance \add is\add* abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but a just weight \add is\add* his delight.\f + \fr 11.1 \ft A false…: Heb. Balances of deceit\f*\f + \fr 11.1 \ft just…: Heb. perfect stone\f*
\add When\add* pride cometh , then cometh shame : but with the lowly \add is\add* wisdom.
The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
Riches profit not in the day of wrath : but righteousness delivereth from death. \p
The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way : but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.\f + \fr 11.5 \ft direct: Heb. rectify\f*
The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in \add their own\add* naughtiness.
When a wicked man dieth , \add his\add* expectation shall perish : and the hope of unjust \add men\add* perisheth.
The righteous is delivered out of trouble , and the wicked cometh in his stead.
An hypocrite with \add his\add* mouth destroyeth his neighbour : but through knowledge shall the just be delivered. \p
When it goeth well with the righteous , the city rejoiceth : and when the wicked perish , \add there is\add* shouting.
By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted : but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked. \p
He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour : but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.\f + \fr 11.12 \ft void…: Heb. destitute of heart\f*
A talebearer revealeth secrets : but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.\f + \fr 11.13 \ft A talebearer: Heb. He that walketh, being a talebearer\f*
Where no counsel \add is\add*, the people fall : but in the multitude of counsellors \add there is\add* safety.

He that is surety for a stranger shall smart \add for it:\add* and he that hateth suretiship is sure.\f + \fr 11.15 \ft smart: Heb. be sore broken\f*\f + \fr 11.15 \ft suretiship: Heb. those that strike hands\f*
A gracious woman retaineth honour : and strong \add men\add* retain riches.
The merciful man doeth good to his own soul : but \add he that is\add* cruel troubleth his own flesh.
The wicked worketh a deceitful work : but to him that soweth righteousness \add shall be\add* a sure reward.
As righteousness \add tendeth\add* to life : so he that pursueth evil \add pursueth it\add* to his own death.
They that are of a froward heart \add are\add* abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but \add such as are\add* upright in \add their\add* way \add are\add* his delight.
\add Though\add* hand \add join\add* in hand , the wicked shall not be unpunished : but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
\add As\add* a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout , \add so is\add* a fair woman which is without discretion.\f + \fr 11.22 \ft is without: Heb. departeth from\f*
The desire of the righteous \add is\add* only good : \add but\add* the expectation of the wicked \add is\add* wrath.
There is that scattereth , and yet increaseth ; and \add there is\add* that withholdeth more than is meet , but \add it tendeth\add* to poverty.
The liberal soul shall be made fat : and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.\f + \fr 11.25 \ft liberal…: Heb. soul of blessing\f*
He that withholdeth corn , the people shall curse him: but blessing \add shall be\add* upon the head of him that selleth \add it\add*.
He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour : but he that seeketh mischief , it shall come unto him.
He that trusteth in his riches shall fall : but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind : and the fool \add shall be\add* servant to the wise of heart.
The fruit of the righteous \add is\add* a tree of life ; and he that winneth souls \add is\add* wise.\f + \fr 11.30 \ft winneth: Heb. taketh\f*
Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth : much more the wicked and the sinner.
